items.title: tls config
items.body:
Fixes #557 

Allows TLS and certificates to be configured through JSON files.
### Examples

``` json
{
    "host": "vapor.codes",
    "port": 443,
    "securityLayer": "tls",
    "tls": {
        "certificates": "ca",
        "signature": "signedFile",
        "caCertificateFile": "/path/to/file.pem"
    }
}
```

``` json
{
    "host": "vapor.codes",
    "port": 443,
    "securityLayer": "tls",
    "tls": {
        "certificates": "files",
        "certificateFile": "/path/to/file.pem",
        "privateKeyFile": "/path/to/file.pem",
        "signature": "signedFile",
        "caCertificateFile": "/path/to/file.pem"
    }
}
```

items.title: configurable
Remove force unwrap in favour of throws
items.body:
### Problem
- the current implementation of `makeJSON()` in protocol extension does not take into account that
  `makeJSON()` throws that's why there is a force unwrap `try` which might lead to crash
### Solution
- make `makeJSON()` throwable function

items.title: Logout wrapper function
items.body:
Hello everyone,
Regarding the auth module
### Introduction

This PR aims at adding a logout wrapper function around 

``` swift
subject().logout()
```
### Motivation

Currently, `request.subject()` is internal and is wrapped with an auth helper that currently allows logging in an user and accessing it through `request.auth.login(_)` and `request.user()` however there is no way for logging the user out.
### Proposed solution

cf Intro.
### Code snippet

Logging out the user would look like 

``` swift
request.auth.logout()
```
### Impact

None.
### Alternative considered

The `request.subject()` method could be made public but but there wouldn't be any more use for an Auth helper.
### Tests

This PR should be delayed since I didn't see any available test for the auth helper. I didn't write any for this PR, however, I'd be happy to add some if interested in another one.

items.title: And documentation is not the same
ProtectMiddleware tests + better auth tests
items.body:
Hi, 
On this PR I added a test for the protect middleware that lacked some.
Also, I reorganised the tests to be more modular and make test functionalities that would require auth easier.

Thanks for reviewing !

items.title: Fixed jpg and jpeg mime type retrieval for FileMiddleware
items.body: The key for retrieving the `jpg` and `jpeg` mime type, was a combined comma separated list of `jpg, jpeg`. This obviously does not work when trying to use `jpg` or `jpeg` as a key. This commit solves that by creating separate entries for both `jpg` and `jpeg`.

items.body: I've added a Telegram bot powered by Vapor.

items.title: Adding Ray Wenderlich Server Side Swift with Vapor
Avoid setting an empty string as a Set-Cookie header.
items.body:
When no cookies were set, Vapor was still returning an empty `Set-Cookie` header. This resulted in problems when I was testing with Postman and I am assuming this is not wanted behaviour.

This pull request fixes this, by validating that the serialisation result of the cookies is not empty. In the case that it is empty, it simply removes the `Set-Cookie` header altogether.

items.title: Fix `Response had no 'Content-Type' header. when request files in Public folder
items.body:
#### Issue:

When requesting a file in `/Public` folder, if this file is cached, the HTTP response had no 'Content-Type' header.` set.
#### Problem

FilleMiddle returns a `Response` without setting `Content-Type` header if the requested file has been cached.
#### Fix

This PR set `Content-Type` header regardless of the file is new or cached.
